intro: Crotalaria camptosepala, commonly known as the zigzag cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive zigzag-shaped pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring palmately compound leaves and yellow flowers with a distinctive spurred structure. Its seeds are enclosed in narrow, twisted pods, which contribute to its common name. Crotalaria camptosepala is also notable for its potential use in soil improvement due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
